purpleculture_pinyin:
xiè
to flow out swiftly; to flood; a torrent; diarrhea; laxative
быстро вытекать; затопить; торрент; понос; слабительное
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 泻)
Pictophonetic: 寫 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 瀉藥 [ xiè yào ]: laxative
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 寫 [ xiě ] to write; to draw, to sketch; to compose
heisig_chinese_memo: If you have diarrhea and it's coming out like water, you're going to be on the toilet for a while. Might as well bring a pen and paper so you can do some writing.
Ru_trainchinese: xiè: (глаг) диарея; течь, литься, наводнять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the photo (寫) of the water (氵) shows diarrhea ...
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you write for a long time and drink a ton of water to stay hydrated you mind think that you have diarrhea when you go to the bathroom because it's so watery.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " water " to " write " sound. " Earth " means that the water flows down rapidly, pouring down. "Jade articles. Ministry of Water: "Spear, pour also." Such as "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Into Huazigang is the third valley of Mayuan": "Tongling reflects the green color, and the stone swells down the red spring." Tang Dynasty Mengjiao "Send Xiao Lianshi to Siming Mountain": "Qianxun straight cracks the peak, the spring falls down a hundred feet."

"To pour down " as a verb means dumping. Such as "Sou Shen Ji. Volume 14: "Digging the hall as a big ridge, draining water in it." "Qi Min Yao Shu.柰林檎": "Pour out the juice, place it on top, drink the juice with ashes, just like making rice noodles."

" Diarrhea " also means excretion and excretion. Such as "Historical Records. Biography of Bian Que Cang: "The so-called qi people should adjust their diets, choose Yan Day, and go to the car to adjust their muscles and blood to relieve their qi." "White Tiger Tong. Qing Xing: "The kidneys are responsible for diarrhea, and the bladder can often have heat, so it must be difficult first." It also refers to the abdominal writing, such as "Compendium of Materia Medica. Fragrant grass. "Peony": "(Peony) is the same as licorice to relieve abdominal pain, and the same as Coptis for diarrhea."

" Diarrhea " pass " diarrhea ", expressed saline that soil containing high salt land, adverse plant growth. "Ji Yun. "Rhyme": "Xie, halogen also." Such as "Historical Records. "The Biographies of Commodities": "The Taigong Wang was sealed in Yingqiu, where the bittern was removed, and the people were few." Pei Qi quoted Xu Guang and said: "Removing bittern, salty land." Another example is "Lun Heng. "Book Explanation": "There is no elk in the soil, and no grain in the soil."
humanum_short_description_en: From " water ", " write " sound. " Earth " means that the water flows down rapidly, pouring down.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「寫」聲。「瀉」表示水往下急流、傾瀉。《玉篇．水部》：「瀉，傾也。」如《文選．謝靈運〈入華子崗是麻源第三谷〉》：「銅陵映碧潤，石磴瀉紅泉。」唐代孟郊〈送蕭煉師入四明山〉：「千尋直裂峰，百尺倒瀉泉。」

　　「瀉」作動詞表示傾倒。如《搜神記．卷十四》：「掘堂上作大坎，瀉水其中。」《齊民要術．柰林檎》：「瀉去汁，置布於上，以灰飲汁，如作米粉法。」

　　「瀉」又表示排出、排泄。如《史記．扁鵲倉公列傳》：「所謂氣者，當調飲食，擇晏日，車步廣志，以適筋骨肉血脈，以瀉氣。」《白虎通．情性》：「腎者主瀉，膀胱常能有熱，故先決難也。」也特指腹寫，如《本草綱目．芳草類．芍藥》：「（芍藥）同甘草止腹痛，同黃連止瀉痢。」

　　「瀉」通「潟」，表示鹽碱地，即土壤中含鹽分較高的土地，不利植物生長。《集韻．禡韻》：「瀉，鹵也。」如《史記．貨殖列傳》：「太公望封於營丘，地瀉鹵，人民寡。」裴駰集解引徐廣曰：「瀉鹵，鹹地也。」又如《論衡．書解》：「土山無麋鹿，瀉土無五穀。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「寫」聲。「瀉」表示水往下急流、傾瀉。

Pictophonetic: 寫 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.

    • 寫 [ xiě ] to write; to draw, to sketch; to compose
